text.13: ثُمَّ لَا يَمُوْتُ فِيْهَا وَلَا يَحْيٰىۗ

text.3: Yang menentukan kadar (masing-masing) dan memberi petunjuk,
text.6: Kami akan membacakan (Al-Qur'an) kepadamu (Muhammad) sehingga engkau tidak akan lupa,
text.7: kecuali jika Allah menghendaki. Sungguh, Dia mengetahui yang terang dan yang tersembunyi.
text.8: Dan Kami akan memudahkan bagimu ke jalan kemudahan (mencapai kebahagiaan dunia dan akhirat),
text.9: oleh sebab itu berikanlah peringatan, karena peringatan itu bermanfaat,
text.10: orang yang takut (kepada Allah) akan mendapat pelajaran,
text.11: dan orang-orang yang celaka (kafir) akan menjauhinya,
text.12: (yaitu) orang yang akan memasuki api yang besar (neraka),
text.13: selanjutnya dia di sana tidak mati dan tidak (pula) hidup.
text.14: Sungguh beruntung orang yang menyucikan diri (dengan beriman),

text.16: Sedangkan kamu (orang-orang kafir) memilih kehidupan dunia,

text.1: Exalt the name of your Lord, the Most High,
text.3: And Who determines and then guides,
text.4: And Who brings forth the pasture,
text.5: And then makes it blackened stubble.
text.6: We will make you recite, [O Muhammad], and you will not forget,
text.7: Except what Allah wills. Indeed, He knows what is declared and what is hidden.
text.8: And We will ease you toward ease.
text.9: So remind, if the reminder should benefit;
text.10: He who fears [Allah] will be reminded.
text.11: But the wretched will avoid it,
text.12: [He] who will enter the greatest Fire,
text.13: Then he will neither die therein nor live.
text.14: He has certainly succeeded who purifies himself,
text.15: And mentions the name of his Lord and prays.
text.16: But you prefer the worldly life,

text.19: The scriptures of Abraham and Moses.

text.1: Allah memerintahkan Rasul-Nya agar menyucikan nama-Nya dari segala sesuatu yang tidak sesuai dengan kebesaran serta kemuliaan zat dan sifat-Nya. Nama Allah hanya diucapkan dalam rangka memuji-Nya, tidak boleh sesuatu dinamai dengan nama-Nya. Mahasuci Allah Yang Mahatinggi.
text.2:
Allah menerangkan bahwa Dialah yang menciptakan dan menyempurnakan penciptaan segala makhluk. Allah pula yang menentukan segala sesuatu menurut bentuk dan ukuran yang tepat dan seimbang. Di samping itu, Dia menetapkan ketentuan-ketentuan dan hukum-hukum yang berlaku bagi tiap-tiap makhluk-Nya, sehingga dapat hidup berkembang biak, dan menjaga hidupnya masing-masing.

Allah-lah yang menumbuhkan rumput-rumputan yang hijau dan segar untuk makanan binatang dan ternak yang kemudian dijadikan-Nya kering dengan warna kehitam-hitaman. Allah-lah yang menumbuhkan rumput-rumputan dan mengubahnya menjadi kering, bukanlah patung-patung yang disembah oleh orang kafir itu.

text.6:
Dalam ayat ini diterangkan bahwa Allah menurunkan Al-Qur'an kepada Nabi Muhammad untuk dibacanya dan Ia akan membukakan hati Nabi-Nya dan menguatkan ingatannya. Dengan demikian, setelah mendengarnya satu kali, maka ia tidak akan lupa apa yang telah didengarnya. Allah berfirman:

Maka Mahatinggi Allah, Raja yang sebenar-benarnya. Dan janganlah engkau (Muhammad) tergesa-gesa (membaca) Al-Qur'an sebelum selesai diwahyukan kepadamu, dan katakanlah, "Ya Tuhanku, tambahkanlah ilmu kepadaku." (thaha/20: 114)

Dan firman-Nya:

Jangan engkau (Muhammad) gerakkan lidahmu (untuk membaca Al-Qur'an) karena hendak cepat-cepat (menguasai)nya. Sesungguhnya Kami yang akan mengumpulkannya (di dadamu) dan membacakannya. (al-Qiyamah/75: 16-17)
text.7:
Dalam ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa bila Ia menghendaki agar Nabi Muhammad melupakan apa yang telah diwahyukan, maka hal itu dapat dilakukan-Nya. Allah berfirman:

Dan sesungguhnya jika Kami menghendaki, niscaya Kami lenyapkan apa yang telah Kami wahyukan kepadamu (Muhammad), dan engkau tidak akan mendapatkan seorang pembela pun terhadap Kami. (al-Isra'/17: 86)

Tidak lupa apa yang sudah didengar Nabi Muhammad satu kali itu adalah karunia dan kebaikan dari Allah. Sesungguhnya Dia mengetahui apa yang terang dan apa yang tersembunyi, apa yang disebutkan dan apa yang dirahasiakan.
text.8: Dalam ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa Ia akan memberi Nabi-Nya taufik kepada jalan yang mudah, yang membawa kepada kebahagiaan di dunia dan di akhirat. Dialah yang memberinya agama yang mudah diterima jiwa dan tidak sukar dipahami oleh akal.
text.9: Dalam ayat ini, Allah memerintahkan Rasul-Nya agar memperingatkan umat manusia tentang yang telah ia terima dari-Nya. Allah menyatakan bahwa peringatan itu amat besar kegunaan dan faedahnya bagi manusia, karena peringatan itu memberi petunjuk kepadanya tentang cara-cara mencapai kebahagiaan hidup di dunia dan di akhirat. Akan tetapi, ternyata mereka tetap saja membangkang dan ingkar. Maka Rasulullah janganlah bersedih hati.
text.10: Dalam ayat ini, Allah menjelaskan bahwa mereka yang beruntung adalah yang dapat menerima panggilan atau peringatan Rasul-Nya, serta takut kepada Allah dan siksaan-Nya. Mereka inilah yang mempergunakan pikiran mereka yang waras untuk mencapai kebenaran yang kelak akan menjadi pegangan hidup mereka.
text.11:
Dalam ayat-ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa bagi orang yang ingkar, durhaka, dan menjauhkan diri dari petunjuk-petunjuk yang diberikan Nabi Muhammad, tidak akan berfaedah peringatan yang disampaikan. Oleh karena itu, mereka tetap dalam kekafiran dan akan dilemparkan ke dalam neraka yang paling bawah.

Secara ringkas, orang yang menghadapi panggilan Nabi Muhammad ke jalan Allah itu ada tiga golongan:

1.Golongan orang yang mengetahui dan yakin akan kebenarannya, tidak ada keraguan sedikit pun di dalam hatinya. Orang ini adalah orang mukmin yang sempurna (mu'min kamil) yang takut kepada Tuhannya.

2.Golongan orang yang dalam menerima petunjuk, kemudian ia yakin akan petunjuk itu, lalu menyatakan keimanannya. Orang ini adalah golongan yang agak kurang nilainya dari yang pertama.

3.Golongan yang durhaka dan ingkar, yang telah tertutup hatinya dari panggilan ke jalan Allah. Mereka ini adalah golongan yang paling jahat dan paling jauh dari kebaikan.
text.12:
Dalam ayat-ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa bagi orang yang ingkar, durhaka, dan menjauhkan diri dari petunjuk-petunjuk yang diberikan Nabi Muhammad, tidak akan berfaedah peringatan yang disampaikan. Oleh karena itu, mereka tetap dalam kekafiran dan akan dilemparkan ke dalam neraka yang paling bawah.

1.Golongan orang yang mengetahui dan yakin akan kebenarannya, tidak ada keraguan sedikit pun di dalam hatinya. Orang ini adalah orang mukmin yang sempurna (mu'min kamil) yang takut kepada Tuhannya.

2.Golongan orang yang dalam menerima petunjuk, kemudian ia yakin akan petunjuk itu, lalu menyatakan keimanannya. Orang ini adalah golongan yang agak kurang nilainya dari yang pertama.

3.Golongan yang durhaka dan ingkar, yang telah tertutup hatinya dari panggilan ke jalan Allah. Mereka ini adalah golongan yang paling jahat dan paling jauh dari kebaikan.
text.13:
Dalam ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa orang-orang yang dimasukkan ke dalam neraka itu menjalani siksaan yang tidak ada habis-habisnya. Mereka merasakan sakit yang tidak ada batasnya, tidak mati di dalamnya dan tidak pula hidup. Allah berfirman:

Dan orang-orang yang kafir, bagi mereka neraka Jahanam. Mereka tidak dibinasakan hingga mereka mati, dan tidak diringankan dari mereka azabnya. Demikianlah Kami membalas setiap orang yang sangat kafir. (Fathir/35: 36)
text.14:
Allah menerangkan bahwa orang yang beruntung, yaitu terhindar dari siksa akhirat, adalah orang yang bersih, beriman kepada Allah dan tidak mempersekutukan-Nya, serta percaya kepada yang disampaikan oleh Nabi Muhammad saw.

Bila terlintas dalam hatinya dan ia ingat sifat-sifat Tuhan yang mempunyai kebesaran dan kemuliaan, maka ketika itu pula ia tunduk kepada kekuasaan-Nya lalu sujud melakukan salat. Allah berfirman:

Sesungguhnya orang-orang yang beriman adalah mereka yang apabila disebut nama Allah gemetar hatinya, dan apabila dibacakan ayat-ayat-Nya kepada mereka, bertambah (kuat) imannya dan hanya kepada Tuhan mereka bertawakal. (al-Anfal/8: 2)
text.15:
Allah menerangkan bahwa orang yang beruntung, yaitu terhindar dari siksa akhirat, adalah orang yang bersih, beriman kepada Allah dan tidak mempersekutukan-Nya, serta percaya kepada yang disampaikan oleh Nabi Muhammad saw.

Bila terlintas dalam hatinya dan ia ingat sifat-sifat Tuhan yang mempunyai kebesaran dan kemuliaan, maka ketika itu pula ia tunduk kepada kekuasaan-Nya lalu sujud melakukan salat. Allah berfirman:

text.16:
Dalam ayat-ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa orang kafir lebih mengutamakan kesenangan di dunia daripada kesenangan di akhirat. Padahal, semestinya mereka memilih kesenangan akhirat, sesuai dengan yang dikehendaki oleh agama Allah. Kesenangan akhirat itu lebih baik dan kekal abadi, sedangkan kesenangan di dunia akan lenyap diliputi oleh kekotoran dan kesedihan. Meskipun begitu, secara umum manusia perlu seimbang dalam usaha dan mengatur porsi waktu untuk kepentingan dunia dan akhirat, sebagaimana firman Allah:

Dan carilah (pahala) negeri akhirat dengan apa yang telah dianugerahkan Allah kepadamu, tetapi janganlah kamu lupakan bagianmu di dunia dan berbuat baiklah (kepada orang lain) sebagaimana Allah telah berbuat baik kepadamu, dan janganlah kamu berbuat kerusakan di bumi. Sungguh, Allah tidak menyukai orang yang berbuat kerusakan. (al-Qasas/28: 77)

Sungguh, Allah tidak menyukai orang yang berbuat kerusakan. (al-Qasas/28: 77)
text.18:
Dalam ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa apa yang disampaikan-Nya kepada Nabi Muhammad tentang perintah dan larangan, janji anugerah dan peringatan adalah sama dengan apa yang telah terdapat di dalam kitab Nabi Ibrahim dan Nabi Musa. Dengan demikian, Nabi Muhammad hanya mengingatkan kembali kepada agama-Nya yang terdahulu yang telah dilupakan oleh manusia. Agama yang ada itu telah diubah oleh tangan-tangan manusia, dirusak oleh hawa nafsu dan adat istiadat nenek moyang mereka sehingga telah menyimpang dari yang sebenarnya. Firman Allah:

Dan sungguh, (Al-Qur'an) ini benar-benar diturunkan oleh Tuhan seluruh alam, Yang dibawa turun oleh ar-Ruh al-Amin (Jibril), ke dalam hatimu (Muhammad) agar engkau termasuk orang yang memberi peringatan, dengan bahasa Arab yang jelas. Dan sungguh, (Al-Qur'an) itu (disebut) dalam kitab-kitab orang yang terdahulu. (asy-Syu'ara'/26: 192-196)

Dia (Allah) telah mensyariatkan kepadamu agama yang telah diwasiatkan-Nya kepada Nuh dan apa yang telah Kami wahyukan kepadamu (Muhammad) dan apa yang telah Kami wasiatkan kepada Ibrahim, Musa dan Isa yaitu tegakkanlah agama (keimanan dan ketakwaan) dan janganlah kamu berpecah-belah di dalamnya. Sangat berat bagi orang-orang musyrik (untuk mengikuti) agama yang kamu serukan kepada mereka. Allah memilih orang yang Dia kehendaki kepada agama tauhid dan memberi petunjuk kepada (agama)-Nya bagi orang yang kembali (kepada-Nya). (asy-Syura/42: 13)

en.name: The Most High
en.source: Aplikasi Quran Kementrian Agama Republik Indonesia

text.1: Allah commands His Messenger to sanctify His name from everything that is not in accordance with the greatness and glory of His essence and attributes. The name of Allah should only be uttered in the context of praising Him; nothing should be named with His name. Glorified is Allah, the Most High.
text.2:
Allah explains that He is the One who created and perfected the creation of all creatures. Allah also determines everything according to its precise and balanced form and measure. In addition, He establishes regulations and laws that apply to each of His creatures, so that they can live, reproduce, and maintain their respective lives.

Allah is the One who grows green and fresh pastures for the food of animals and livestock, which He then turns into dry, blackish-colored fodder. Allah is the One who grows the pastures and transforms them into dry fodder, not the idols that are worshipped by the disbelievers.
text.3:
Allah explains that He is the One who creates and perfects the creation of all creatures. Allah also determines everything according to the appropriate and balanced form and measure. In addition, He establishes provisions and laws that apply to each of His creatures, so that they can live, reproduce, and maintain their respective lives.

Allah is the One who grows green and fresh pastures for the food of animals and livestock, which He then turns into dry, blackish-colored fodder. Allah is the One who grows the pastures and transforms them into dry fodder, not the idols that are worshipped by the disbelievers.
text.4:
Allah explains that He is the One who creates and perfects the creation of all beings. Allah also determines everything according to its precise and balanced form and measure. In addition, He establishes regulations and laws that apply to each of His creatures, so that they can live, reproduce, and maintain their respective lives.

Allah is the One who causes green and fresh pastures to grow for the food of animals and livestock, which He then turns into dry, blackish vegetation. Allah is the One who causes the grass to grow and transforms it into dry hay, not the idols that are worshipped by the disbelievers.
text.5:
Allah explains that He is the One who creates and perfects the creation of all beings. Allah also determines everything according to precise and balanced forms and measures. In addition, He establishes regulations and laws that apply to each of His creatures, so that they can live, reproduce, and maintain their respective lives.

It is Allah who causes green and fresh pastures to grow for the food of animals and livestock, which He then turns dry with a darkish hue. It is Allah who causes the grass to grow and transforms it into dryness, not the idols that are worshipped by the disbelievers.
text.6:
This verse explains that Allah revealed the Qur'an to the Prophet Muhammad so that he could recite it, and He would open the Prophet's heart and strengthen his memory. Thus, after hearing it once, he would not forget what he had heard. Allah says:

"So exalted is Allah, the Sovereign, the Truth. And, [O Muhammad], do not hasten with [recitation of] the Qur'an before its revelation is completed to you, and say, "My Lord, increase me in knowledge." (Taha/20: 114)

And His saying:

"Move not your tongue concerning the (Qur'an) to make haste therewith. It is for Us to collect it and to give you (O Muhammad) the ability to recite it (and understand its meaning)." (Al-Qiyamah/75: 16-17)
text.7:
In this verse, Allah explains that if He willed for Prophet Muhammad to forget what had been revealed to him, then He could do so. Allah says:

"And if We willed, We could surely take away that which We have revealed to you, then you would not find for yourself concerning it any advocate against Us." (al-Isra'/17: 86)

That Prophet Muhammad does not forget what he has heard even once is a favor and kindness from Allah. Indeed, He knows what is apparent and what is hidden, what is mentioned and what is kept secret.
text.8: In this verse, Allah explains that He will grant His Prophet success in the easy path, which leads to happiness in this world and the Hereafter. He is the One who gave him a religion that is easily accepted by the soul and not difficult to understand by the intellect.
text.9: In this verse, Allah commands His Messenger to warn mankind about what he has received from Him. Allah states that the warning is of great use and benefit to mankind, because the warning guides them on how to achieve happiness in life in this world and in the Hereafter. However, it turns out that they still rebel and deny. Therefore, the Messenger of Allah should not grieve.
text.10: In this verse, Allah explains that those who are fortunate are those who can accept the call or warning of His Messenger, and fear Allah and His punishment. These are the ones who use their sound minds to reach the truth that will later become their guide in life.
text.11:
In these verses, Allah explains that for those who disbelieve, are disobedient, and distance themselves from the guidance given by the Prophet Muhammad, the warnings conveyed will be of no benefit. Therefore, they remain in disbelief and will be thrown into the lowest depths of Hell.

In summary, those who face the call of the Prophet Muhammad to the path of Allah are of three categories:

1.  Those who know and are certain of its truth, without the slightest doubt in their hearts. This person is a perfect believer (mu'min kamil) who fears his Lord.

2.  Those who, upon receiving guidance, then become certain of that guidance, and then declare their faith. This group is somewhat less in value than the first.

3.  Those who are disobedient and disbelieving, whose hearts have been sealed off from the call to the path of Allah. These are the most evil and furthest from goodness.
text.12:
In these verses, Allah explains that for those who disbelieve, are disobedient, and distance themselves from the guidance given by the Prophet Muhammad, the warnings conveyed will be of no benefit. Therefore, they remain in disbelief and will be cast into the lowest depths of Hell.

In summary, those who face the call of the Prophet Muhammad to the path of Allah are of three categories:

1.  A group of people who know and are certain of its truth, without the slightest doubt in their hearts. These are the perfect believers (mu'min kamil) who fear their Lord.

2.  A group of people who, upon receiving guidance, become convinced of that guidance and then declare their faith. This group is of somewhat lesser value than the first.

3.  A group who are disobedient and disbelieving, whose hearts have been sealed off from the call to the path of Allah. These are the most evil and furthest from goodness.
text.13:
In this verse, Allah explains that those who are placed in hell endure endless torment. They feel pain without limit, neither dying within it nor truly living. Allah states:

And those who disbelieve - for them is the fire of Hell. [Death] is not decreed for them so they may die, nor is its torment lightened for them. Thus do We recompense every ungrateful one. (Fathir/35: 36)
text.14:
Allah explains that the fortunate person, namely the one who is saved from the torment of the afterlife, is the one who is pure, believes in Allah and does not associate partners with Him, and believes in what was conveyed by the Prophet Muhammad saw.

When it crosses his mind and he remembers the attributes of God who possesses greatness and glory, then at that very moment he submits to His power and prostrates in prayer. Allah says:

"The believers are only those who, when Allah is mentioned, their hearts become fearful, and when His verses are recited to them, it increases them in faith; and upon their Lord they rely." (al-Anfal/8: 2)
text.15:
Allah explains that the fortunate person, namely the one who is saved from the torment of the afterlife, is the one who is pure, believes in Allah and does not associate partners with Him, and believes in what was conveyed by the Prophet Muhammad saw.

When it crosses his mind and he remembers the attributes of God who possesses greatness and glory, then at that very moment he submits to His power and prostrates himself in prayer. Allah says:

"The believers are only those who, when Allah is mentioned, their hearts tremble with fear, and when His verses are recited to them, they increase them in faith; and upon their Lord they rely." (al-Anfal/8: 2)
text.16:
In these verses, Allah explains that disbelievers prioritize worldly pleasures over the pleasures of the afterlife. In fact, they should choose the pleasures of the afterlife, in accordance with what is desired by the religion of Allah. The pleasures of the afterlife are better and eternally lasting, while worldly pleasures will vanish, covered by filth and sorrow. Even so, in general, humans need to be balanced in their efforts and allocate time proportionally for the interests of this world and the afterlife, as Allah says:

"And seek, through what Allah has given you, the home of the Hereafter; and [yet], do not forget your share of the world. And do good as Allah has done good to you. And desire not corruption in the land. Indeed, Allah does not like corrupters." (al-Qasas/28: 77)
text.17:
In these verses, Allah explains that disbelievers prioritize worldly pleasures over the pleasures of the Hereafter. In fact, they should choose the pleasures of the Hereafter, in accordance with what is desired by the religion of Allah. The pleasures of the Hereafter are better and eternally lasting, while worldly pleasures will vanish, covered by impurity and sorrow. Even so, in general, humans need to be balanced in their efforts and allocate time proportionally for the interests of this world and the Hereafter, as Allah says:

"But seek, through that which Allah has bestowed upon you, the home of the Hereafter; and [yet], do not forget your share of the world. And do good as Allah has done good to you. And desire not corruption in the land. Indeed, Allah does not like corrupters." (al-Qasas/28: 77)
text.18:
In this verse, Allah explains that what He conveyed to the Prophet Muhammad concerning commands and prohibitions, promises of grace, and warnings, is the same as what was contained in the books of Prophet Ibrahim and Prophet Musa. Thus, Prophet Muhammad only reminded people of His previous religion which had been forgotten by mankind. That existing religion had been altered by human hands, corrupted by desires and the customs of their ancestors, so that it had deviated from the truth. Allah says:

"And indeed, this [Qur'an] is a revelation from the Lord of the worlds. The Trustworthy Spirit has brought it down Upon your heart, [O Muhammad] - that you may be of the warners - In a clear Arabic language. And indeed, it is [mentioned] in the scriptures of former peoples." (ash-Shu'ara'/26: 192-196)

"He has ordained for you of religion what He enjoined upon Noah and that which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what We enjoined upon Abraham and Moses and Jesus - to establish the religion and do not be divided therein. Difficult for the polytheists is that to which you invite them. Allah chooses for Himself whom He wills and guides to Himself whoever turns back [to Him]." (ash-Shura/42: 13)
